results.title: 24 Hour party people
results.creator_credit: Film Consortium, Revolution Films, United Artists Corporation, Film Council, Film Four International, Baby Cow, Andrew Eaton and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: This mockumentary is set during Manchester’s rise in the music world from the late 70’s post punk era through to the 80’s rave scene. Inspired by the Sex Pistols Tony Wilson (Steve Coogan) a Cambridge graduate television presenter, starts a record label signing up the band “Joy Division” and then on to running the “Hacienda” nightclub. From depressive post punk morbidness comes “New Order” and then “Happy Mondays” are found. This hedonistic and exciting film shot on digital video shows well the life of drugs, excess and seedy dealing that go hand in hand with the music industry. “24 Hour Party People” is very funny. Those who were around during this important era will enjoy the soundtrack and reminisce to the sounds of “Joy Division”, “New Order”, “Buzzcocks”, “The Clash” and the “Happy Mondays”. Tough Northern humour, outrageous self abuse and self mocking throughout this is a fine portrayal of the Manchester music scene.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Consortium, Revolution Films, United Artists Corporation, Film Council, Film Four International, Baby Cow, Andrew Eaton and Michael Winterbottom

results.title: 21 grams = Twenty one grams
results.creator_credit: Focus Features, This Is That, Y Production, Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu and Robert Salerno
results.brief_description: Following a tragic accident, three people’s lives are connected in a way that is emotionally intense and devastating. Christine (Naomi Watts) is a wife and mother of two girls. Paul (Sean Penn) is a mathematician with a congenital heart problem and a troubled relationship. Jack (Benicio Del Toro) is an ex-con, born-again Christian and father of two children. This revenge-style drama could be told in a straight forward way but the writer Guillermo Arriaga and director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu have chosen a non-linear approach with the story told by glimpses forward and back until becoming clear to the viewer just how these people’s lives do connect. The three leads are convincing in their performances with Watts and Del Toro being nominated for Academy Awards and Sean Penn for a BAFTA.

results.brief_description: The greatest space epic of all time reaches its unforgettable conclusion in 2010 - the year we make contact. While the Earth poises on the brink of nuclear self-destruction, a team of Russian amd American scientists, headed by Roy Scheider and Helen Mirren hurtle to a rendezvous with the abandoned Discovery spacecraft and its sole known survivor, the homicidal computer HAL. Their mission is to ‘awake’ HAL and unravel the puzzling skein of events that culminated in astronaut Dave Bowman’s last transmission, “My God, it’s full of stars!” seen at the end of 2001. This is an emotionally moving thriller in which the human drama takes its rightful place alongside the movie’s visual magic.

results.title: 2001: A Space odyssey [DVD]
results.brief_description: Light years ahead of it’s time, Kubrick’s masterpiece has an awesome scope - his special effects border on miraculous. Inspired by Arthur C. Clarke’s epic book, 2001 moves from the prehistoric birth of intelligence to the emergence of the man as pure thought, somewhere in the future. Cast includes Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood.

results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea
results.brief_description: Walt Disney’s entertaining epic version of Jules Verne’s nautical tale, stars James Mason as the evil, renegade Mastermind, Captain Nemo who pilots the fantastic submarine Nautilus on a memorable, adventure-filled journey beneath the seven seas.

results.title: 2 ou 3 choses que je sais d'elle = 2 or 3 things I know about her
results.creator_credit: Anouchka Films, Argos Films, Le Films du Carosse, Parc Film and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: Godard’s controversial reputation as one of the revolutionaries of film art is due to his use of film and video as mediums of philosophical investigation. This film is an essay which explores the relationships between the Western world and the developing world; the Parisian working class and the Gaulist government; US cultural imperialism and the Vietnam War; and the politics that occur when a male director explores the meaning of “woman”. If all this sounds obscure, difficult and pretentious, it is, but it is also exciting, challenging and powerful. At one point in the film a narrator imagines a synthesis of poetry and painting. “2 or 3 Things I know about her” achieves this synthesis in some of the most dazzling scenes ever filmed. What is this film? Literature or sociology? Documentary or essay? A poem or a lecture? Whatever it is, it is one of the most unique and audacious works in the history of cinema. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: 12 Angry men
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Terence A. Donnelly and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: A young man is accused of fatally stabbing his father, and his fate now lies in the hands of his “peers”: 12 men from all walks of life, different backgrounds, who all bring their own agendas and prejudices with them. Is he innocent or guilty? Is there reasonable doubt? The tension mounts as each piece of evidence is examined again and again. This film provides the viewer with an insight into the American legal system and what may happen behind the scenes of any murder trial. This is an emotionally charged courtroom drama with a star studded cast including Courtney B Vance, Ossie Davis, George C Scott, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Dorian Harewood, James Gandolfini, Tony Danza, Jack Lemon, Hume Croyn, Mykelti Williamson, Edward James and Olmas William Peterson.

results.title: 102 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Edward S. Feldman and Kevin Lima
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Dodie Smith, and a sequel to Disney’s 1996 live-action adaptation of their animated classic, ‘101 Dalmatians’, this live-action film once again features Glenn Close in the role of the over-the-top and rather bizarre Cruella De Vil. After three years in prison Cruella is determined to keep away from animal fur - especially of the doggy kind - but it seems despite all her best intentions, Cruella unwittingly finds herself again embroiled in a ‘haute couture’ situation. Cast includes Ioan Gruffudd, Alice Evans, Tim McInnerny, Ian Richardson, Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: 10 Things I hate about you = Ten Things I hate about you
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Andrew Lazar and Gil Junger
results.brief_description: 10 things I hate about you continues the current trend of modernizing William Shakespeare’s back catalogue, which has produced inspired rethinks like Baz Luhrmann’s vibrant disco take on “Romeo and Juliet”, Julie Taymor’s surreal interpretation of “Titus”, Michael Almereyda’s hi-tech “Hamlet” (featuring Julia Stiles) and the American high school setting of “Othello” called “O” (again featuring Julia Stiles). Not surprising then that Julia Stiles stars in this latest twist on Shakespeare’s classic opposites-attract tale, “The Taming of the shrew”. “10 things I hate about you” sticks to the original story quite closely, mostly foregoing the flowery Elizabethan dialogue for a more appropriate teen slang. Otherwise the story set up is the same, the sweet natured Bianca (Larisa Oleynik) is in love with Cameron (Joseph Gorden-Levitt) but is forbidden to date by her paranoid father unless she finds her older sister a boyfriend. Unfortunately her sister Kate (Julia Stiles) is an ill-tempered shrew whose manner towards men is hostile to say the least. Enter mysterious bad boy Patrick (Heath Ledger), who is enlisted by the desperate lovers to win over the impenetrable Kate. Cast includes Larry Miller, Andrew Keegan, David Krumholtz and Susan May Pratt.

results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence P. Bachmann and George Pollock
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.
